app_metadata.description: Excellent file management and collaboration for public authorities, providers and business - or anyone who values ease of use and digital sovereignty.
app_metadata.name: opencloud

run_as_context.description: OpenCloud runs as any non-root user.
Tika runs as a non-root user.
Radicale runs as a non-root user.

app_metadata.title: OpenCloud

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for OpenCloud

attrs.label: Application URL
attrs.description:
The URL of the OpenCloud application.</br>
Must be HTTPS.</br>
Example: https://cloud.example.com

attrs.label: Insecure Access
attrs.description:
Enabled: Allow access via self-signed SSL certificates.</br>
Disabled: Require a valid SSL certificate.</br>
Note: Even with insecure access enabled, WOPI might still require valid
SSL certificates depending on the collaboration application used
and its configuration.

attrs.label: JWT Secret
attrs.description: The secret to mint and validate JWT tokens.

attrs.label: Enable calendar and contacts
attrs.description:
⚠️ Enabling Radicale will also override the file `proxy.yaml` in your Config Storage.</br>
Your original file will remain untouched. But a file will be created on a upper (docker) layer overriding the original file.</br>

attrs.label: Proof Key Disable
attrs.description: Disable proof key validation for Collaboration.

attrs.label: URL
attrs.description: The URL of the collaboration application. (e.g. https://collabora.example.com)

attrs.label: Insecure
attrs.description: Allow insecure connections to the collaboration application.

attrs.label: JWT Secret
attrs.description: The JWT secret for OnlyOffice authentication. It must match the secret configured in the OnlyOffice server.

attrs.label: Extra Services
attrs.description:
A list of additional services to start in the same OpenCloud process.</br>
For example `collaboration`. Additional config may be required depending on the service.

attrs.label: Host
attrs.description: SMTP host to connect to.

attrs.label: Port
attrs.description: Port of the SMTP host to connect to.

attrs.label: Insecure
attrs.description: Allow insecure connections to the SMTP server.

attrs.label: Encryption
attrs.description: Encryption to use for the SMTP connection.

attrs.label: Username
attrs.description: Username for the SMTP host to connect to.

attrs.label: Password
attrs.description: Password for the SMTP host to connect to.

attrs.label: Additional Content Security Policy
attrs.description:
Additional Content Security Policy directives to add to the default CSP.</br>
These will be merged with the default CSP directives.</br>
Only add here directives/items that are not already present in the CSP File (/etc/opencloud/csp.yaml).</br>
If you notice a directive/item is missing that affects the core functionality of OpenCloud, </br>
or any of the integrations configured via this UI, please open an issue on GitHub.</br>
CSP keywords should be enclosed in single quotes.</br>
Example: `'unsafe-eval'`

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that OpenCloud files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that OpenCloud files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.</br>
NFS Share: Is a NFS share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB/CIFS Share (Mounts a volume to a SMB share)
NFS Share (Mounts a volume to a NFS share)

attrs.label: Read Only
attrs.description: Mount the volume as read only.

attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.

1.0.30.readme:
OpenCloud

OpenCloud is an excellent file management and collaboration for public authorities, providers and business - or anyone who values ease of use and digital sovereignty.
